issue.title: [WIP] Sync with upstream
issue.body:
ðŸš¨ WIP - DO NOT MERGE ðŸš¨

---

Update to commit [f0518d](https://github.com/google/boringssl/commit/f0518d45119dd4dd322a884669daf8247bc3c992).

**Note:** Some tests still fail, see output of `ninja run_tests` below.

Compiled on Windows x64, Apple silicon (ARM), macOS 13.0.

FYI, compilation for x86 works the same, to do so on an M1/M2 Mac - add to `CMakeLists.txt` (both to BSSL and `liboqs`):

```
SET(CMAKE_OSX_ARCHITECTURES "x86_64" CACHE INTERNAL "" FORCE)
SET(CMAKE_OSX_DEPLOYMENT_TARGET "10.13.0" CACHE INTERNAL "" FORCE)
```

issue.title: Update to upstream 5511fa8
issue.body:
** WORK IN PROGRESS **

Update to upstream commit [5511fa8](https://github.com/google/boringssl/commit/5511fa833c96c8caa9b51c13367f057c74d850eb).

comment.body: The `evp_pkey_asn1_method_st` struct (defined in crypto/internal.h) now has an EVP_PKEY_METHOD* field which was set in NULL in our previous PR attempts, this PR sets it correctly and prevents workaround includes that led to errors.

issue.title: Update to upstream 5511fa8
issue.body:
** WORK IN PROGRESS **

Update to upstream commit [5511fa8](https://github.com/google/boringssl/commit/5511fa833c96c8caa9b51c13367f057c74d850eb).

comment.body: Working on upgrading this fork to a more recent boringssl version; CI fails due to Go build errors. Google [upgraded](https://boringssl.googlesource.com/boringssl/+/5511fa833c96c8caa9b51c13367f057c74d850eb) to a more version of Go. The [go.mod](https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/boringssl/blob/master/go.mod) file claims it needs v1.13, but it actually needs v1.16 (when [os.ReadFile](https://pkg.go.dev/os#ReadFile)) was added to the `os` package). Our Docker images use [v1.14](https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/ci-containers/blob/main/ubuntu-focal/Dockerfile#L12), so it seems that the simplest fix is to update these (using this download link: https://go.dev/dl/go1.19.3.linux-amd64.tar.gz). Do you agree, @xvzcf, @baentsch?

issue.title: Update to upstream 5511fa8
issue.body:
** WORK IN PROGRESS **

Update to upstream commit [5511fa8](https://github.com/google/boringssl/commit/5511fa833c96c8caa9b51c13367f057c74d850eb).

comment.body:
> Do you agree, @xvzcf, @baentsch?

Sounds reasonable. Will update the image and trigger CI again when done.

issue.title: Update to upstream 5511fa8
issue.body:
** WORK IN PROGRESS **

Update to upstream commit [5511fa8](https://github.com/google/boringssl/commit/5511fa833c96c8caa9b51c13367f057c74d850eb).

comment.body:
> Sounds reasonable. Will update the image and trigger CI again when done.

Great, thanks. Looks like we only use the openquantumsafe/ci-ubuntu-focal-x86_64 image; not sure if you should (eventually) update the other ones in case we need to build on these platforms as well.

issue.title: Update to upstream 5511fa8
issue.body:
** WORK IN PROGRESS **

Update to upstream commit [5511fa8](https://github.com/google/boringssl/commit/5511fa833c96c8caa9b51c13367f057c74d850eb).

comment.body:
> not sure if you should (eventually) update the other ones in case we need to build on these platforms as well.

Let's cross those bridges if someone sees water flow under them -- if you know what I mean. Or are you aware of anyone needing those other platforms right now? But then they should be moved to active (CI) use.
Have you tried running the OQS tests in this container? The new Doxygen is only a PATCH version bump, so probably nothing should break, but wondering nevertheless ...

issue.title: Classify algorithm status
issue.body:
A concrete NIST announcement date, hurray: https://groups.google.com/a/list.nist.gov/g/pqc-forum/c/7yLIZcFOMF0/m/vn43l1tQAQAJ

Bets still accepted.... :-) Eliminating McEliece and SPHINCS+ would be a boon for our CI runtime (and the world's power-consumption-induced CO2 emissions).

comment.body:
> In light of https://groups.google.com/a/list.nist.gov/g/pqc-forum/c/4MBurXr58Rs/m/WX3u_lU_AQAJ, shall we remove NTRU as well?

@jschanck Any comments before we take a decision?  Are there any plans for NTRU to be considered for standardization elsewhere?

issue.title: Classify algorithm status
issue.body:
A concrete NIST announcement date, hurray: https://groups.google.com/a/list.nist.gov/g/pqc-forum/c/7yLIZcFOMF0/m/vn43l1tQAQAJ

Bets still accepted.... :-) Eliminating McEliece and SPHINCS+ would be a boon for our CI runtime (and the world's power-consumption-induced CO2 emissions).

comment.body: Not that I'm aware of. I think it's safe to remove it.
